intro: Sida anomala f. roseiflora, commonly known as the pink mullein, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its fuzzy, velvety leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy ornamental plant. Its botanical features make it both visually appealing and ecologically beneficial.
